column7: "…a pair of replicate census routes in each of the seven habitats…all census routes started at 5:30 am and ended at approximately 11:00 am…recorded the behavior (e.g., traveling, resting, feeding) of the individual first seen…could entail following the group for up to one hour...and continued the census...In addition to opportunistic sightings...during censuses, we routinely searched for these two species..."
column9: "Once all group sightings were plotted on the map, I drew the smallest possible polygon that included all of the group observation points. I counted the number of squares inside this polygon, and multiplied this number by 0.25 ha to estimate the home range size of each group...In many cases, sample sizes were inadequate to accurately determine home range size...I conducted [a] polynomial regression of estimated home range on the number of observations...as an unbiased estimate of home range size."

column7: Scan sampling every ten minutes
Scan sampling every three minutes
column8:
"We recorded activity as moving, resting, feeding, singing
and other (Table 1). Feeding comprised picking, chewing,
or swallowing food. During feeding bouts, we recorded the
food species and specific part eaten (tree fruit, liana fruit,
leaves and buds, flower, animals) (Ni et al. 2014). We
defined singing as solo or duet songs produced in response
to songs of the neighboring group or without any recognizable
external stimulus, while alarm calling was classified
as vocal notes uttered by the gibbons due to
identifiable disturbances...All other behaviors. Included conflict activity between groups, social behavior (grooming, playing), and alarm calling (short, sharp
calling such as ‘‘hoo’’, which takes place when individuals are disturbed)

column1: Fan et al. 2009; 2008; Ni et al. 2014
column7: Scan sampling every five minutes
column8:
"We recorded activity as resting, traveling, feeding, calling, playing, and other.
Resting includes any inactive posture (sitting, lying, or hanging); the category
also includes instances of grooming, which always occurred during rest.
Traveling comprises movement (brachiating, climbing, and jumping). Feeding
comprises picking, chewing, or swallowing food. Calling comprises only the duet
calling at the time of the 5-min scan. Playing refers to social play between ≥2
individuals, and includes solo play of the infant when near its mother. We
recorded conflict activity between groups, alarm calling, and unidentified
behavior as other. During feeding bouts, we classified food items as fruit, figs,
leaves (tree leaves and buds, vine leaves and buds, and epiphyte leaves), flowers,
and other ingesta...To avoid overrepresenting the
influence of March and April, which we sampled in both 2005 and 2006, on the
annual mean we first averaged values from the 2 mo and then calculated annual
means from 12 different months"
